newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Amgen off on drug study.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Amgen off on drug study.

text.p: Shares in Amgen Inc fell 2-5/8 to 57 preceding Friday's U.S. market open on news of research that found leptin, a weight-loss drug under development by the company, may cause diabetes.
Traders said the news had not affected other biotechhology issues, calling the news "pretty product specific."
Leptin was discovered two years ago at Rockefeller University and has been shown to cause weight loss in mice.
Last year, Amgen paid $20 million for the rights to the gene that produces leptin, and in May began human clinical trials of the compound.
U S West Media Group traded 3/8 higher to 18-1/2 after the company announced a buyback of up to $350 million shares.
Traders also said the stock was supported by Standard & Poor's increasing U S West's weighting in the S&P 500 index because of U S West's acqusition of Continental Cablevision.
Elsewhere, Microsoft rose to 151 from 149-5/8, Sun Microsystems added 1/4 to 58-3/8 and Intel gained to 120-5/16 from 119-7/8.
